info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 5:28PM CDT until August 29 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN HUTCHINSON...SOUTHWESTERN HANSFORD...SOUTHERN SHERMAN...SOUTHEASTERN DALLAM...MOORE AND EASTERN HARTLEY COUNTIES... At 528 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Gruver to 6 miles northwest of Dumas to 7 miles north of Hartley, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Dumas, Hartley, Cactus, Sunray, Stinnett, Gruver, Morse and Pringle. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
